info.author: Jim Fulton
info.description:
\
    Sometimes, you want to use a mapping object like a regular object.

    ``zc.mappingobject`` provides a wrapper for a mapping objects that
    provides both attribute and item access.

    >>> import zc.mappingobject
    >>> mapping = dict(a=1)
    >>> ob = zc.mappingobject.mappingobject(mapping)

    >>> ob.a
    1
    >>> ob.a = 2
    >>> ob.a
    2
    >>> mapping
    {'a': 2}

    >>> list(ob)
    ['a']

    >>> len(ob)
    1

    >>> ob['a'] = 3
    >>> ob.a
    3
    >>> mapping
    {'a': 3}

    >>> del ob.a
    >>> mapping
    {}
    >>> ob.a
    Traceback (most recent call last):
    ...
    AttributeError: a

    >>> ob.b = 1
    >>> mapping
    {'b': 1}

    >>> del ob['b']
    >>> mapping
    {}
info.name: zc.mappingobject
info.html_description:
Sometimes, you want to use a mapping object like a regular object.

zc.mappingobject provides a wrapper for a mapping objects that provides both attribute and item access.

>>> import zc.mappingobject
>>> mapping = dict(a=1)
>>> ob = zc.mappingobject.mappingobject(mapping)

>>> ob.a
1
>>> ob.a = 2
>>> ob.a
2
>>> mapping
{'a': 2}

>>> list(ob)
['a']

>>> len(ob)
1

>>> ob['a'] = 3
>>> ob.a
3
>>> mapping
{'a': 3}

>>> del ob.a
>>> mapping
{}
>>> ob.a
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
AttributeError: a

>>> ob.b = 1
>>> mapping
{'b': 1}

>>> del ob['b']
>>> mapping
{}
